arts.ttl: Chris Brunt makes 'unexpected' admission as Josh Maja inspires West Brom
arts.sum: West Brom's interim manager Chris Brunt has praised his team's overall performance following their 3-1 home win over Preston, securing his first victory since assuming the stand-in role. His link-up play is so good, he’s an intelligent football player, does a really good job for the team and brings a lot of other attacking threats into the game by dropping into spaces and he did well today."

arts.ttl: Swansea City's Luke Williams makes admission amid West Brom job speculation
arts.sum: Williams is still the favourite with bookmakers for the vacant West Brom job

arts.ttl: Josh Maja fires West Brom to victory over Preston to send Baggies back into play-off spots
arts.sum: The Baggies took the lead 18 minutes in when Mikey Johnston's skilful footwork on the left allowed him to pass the ball across goal, setting up Maja to fire it into the net. Preston, who have only secured one away win this season, saw their hopes of a second dashed by half-time as Maja's double and Callum Styles' goal put the hosts firmly in control.

arts.ttl: Maja nets twice as managerless WBA beat Preston
arts.sum: Josh Maja's first-half double helped West Brom move back into the Sky Bet Championship play-off places with a comfortable 3-1 win over Preston.

arts.ttl: West Bromwich Albion 3-1 Preston North End: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Maja makes the difference
arts.sum: West Bromwich Albion defeat Preston North End on New Year's Day, as the Baggies sweep their visitors aside at the Hawthorns to start 2025 in style.

arts.ttl: Josh Maja inspires West Brom to comfortable victory over Preston
arts.sum: Callum Styles was also on target for the Baggies.

arts.ttl: Sources: Highly-rated manager who lets his teams 'be expressive' turns down West Bromwich Albion approach
arts.sum: TBR Football can exclusively reveal that Lee Carsley has been approached by West Bromwich Albion over their managerial vacancy. The Baggies are currently searching for...

arts.ttl: West Brom next manager latest as clear favourite remains and Liverpool coach emerges
arts.sum: Mark Robins (5/1) and Steven Schumacher (8/1) are also in the mix, while Russell Martin remains a contender at 9/1 despite rumours he's already declined the position. Swansea City's Luke Williams is still the bookies' favourite to fill the managerial void at West Bromwich Albion.
